abstract: Irwin Meyer, 96-year-old Navy veteran who was musical director and conductor at his American Legion and did curator work at Fort Hamilton's military museum, died May 19 after being hit by a car during one of his evening walks.
lead_paragraph: In the weeks before he died, Irwin Meyer rehearsed his big brass band, went swing dancing, did curating sessions at Fort Hamilton’s military museum and made his usual rounds visiting veterans at local hospitals.

headline.main: American Legion Band Maestro Kept Baton Moving at 96
headline.print_headline: American Legion Maestro Kept Baton in Motion at 96
